intro: Phymatopteris pingpienensis, commonly known as the Pingpien huperzia, is a species of fern native to China. It belongs to the family Huperjiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, leathery fronds. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in forest understories. Its sporangia are clustered in sori on the underside of the leaves, a common feature in ferns. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological niche.
